'Bacteriophage T7' is a bacteriophage capable of infecting susceptible bacterial
cells. It infects most strains of [[Escherichia coli]] (including [[Escherichia
coli O157:H7|E. coli O157:H7]], a strain of E. coli which can cause foodborne
illness). Bacteriophage T7 is a DNA virus that has a lytic life cycle. The T7
bacteriophage has several properties that make it an ideal phage for
experimentation.
